newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Former RBA governor Fraser says jobless a concern.
newsitem.headline: Former RBA governor Fraser says jobless a concern.

text.p: Former Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) governor Bernie Fraser said on Tuesday that unemployment remained a problem in Australia and would have to be a continuing cause of concern for policy makers.

Fraser, who left the RBA in late 1996, said he could not say what the central bank would do next on its interest rates policy, but noted the objectives were to lower unemployment and achieve stronger growth with low inflation.
"Unemployment is a problem so it will have to be looked at and continue to be looked at," Fraser said at a news conference for the Superannuation Trust of Australia.
Unemployment was 8.7 percent in April and has been struck at or above 8.5 percent for the past year.
Fraser, the chairman of the Trust's investment committee, said the Australia and international economies were "not too bad".
The Reserve Bank last Friday reduced Australia's official cash rate by 0.5 percentage points to 5.5 percent, the fourth rate cut in less than a year.
